>
>Whats the name of the measure which covers everything which must be
>tested, if one wants to test everything.
>
>I mean if bugless tests are written to the that perfect measure and
>all test execute green, then there is no bug in the tested code I
>think.
>
>Is such a perfect measure existing?

Well, "number of defects" is a measure of software correctness, but not a measure of the much more important concept of software Quality. (Capital "Q".) No single measure is sufficient. Weighing a number of measures is the only way.
